title: Until Dawn
description: Interactive horror drama where eight friends are trapped on a mountain and must survive until dawn, with choices determining who lives or dies.
personal_review: This one nailed the 'cabin in the woods' teen horror movie feel; the butterfly effect mechanic makes every choice feel genuinely terrifying.

title: The Quarry
description: Cinematic teen horror game where players control nine camp counselors as their summer night turns into a blood-soaked nightmare.
personal_review: A spiritual successor that perfectly captures the summer camp slasher vibe with gorgeous graphics, though the ending felt a little less impactful than its predecessor.

title: Silent Hill f
description: A new entry in the Silent Hill franchise set in 1960s Japan, blending psychological horror with haunting visuals and narrative depth.
personal_review: The master of atmosphere. Nothing captures psychological dread and existential decay quite like exploring that iconic, fog-choked town.

title: Resident Evil
description: Long-running horror franchise featuring viral outbreaks, zombie survival, and intense action-horror gameplay.
personal_review: The absolute foundation of survival horror. The original fixed-camera tension and the later action-horror evolution are all essential horror gaming history.

title: Outlast
description: First-person survival horror where players navigate an asylum using only a camcorder for light while evading monstrous inmates.
personal_review: Pure, unadulterated found-footage panic. The lack of combat forces you into some of the most frantic and helpless stealth sequences in the genre.

title: Five Nights at Freddy's
description: Point-and-click survival horror where players must survive nights guarding a haunted pizza restaurant with killer animatronics.
personal_review: A brilliantly simple concept that created a cultural phenomenon. It proves that jumpscares, when timed perfectly, are still effective horror tools.

title: Dead by Daylight
description: Multiplayer survival horror where four survivors try to escape from one killer in an asymmetric 4v1 match.
personal_review: The definitive asymmetrical horror experience. The thrill of trying to outsmart an iconic killer with three friends never gets old—pure adrenaline.

title: Little Nightmares
description: Puzzle-platformer set in a surreal world filled with monstrous adults; a small child must escape horrifying environments.
personal_review: A beautifully grotesque puzzle-platformer. It uses scale and surreal art direction to make you feel tiny, vulnerable, and constantly unsettled.

title: Phasmophobia
description: Co-op ghost-hunting simulator where players investigate haunted locations to identify paranormal entities using equipment.
personal_review: The best co-op fear generator out there. Shouting at ghosts through your mic is hilarious until the lights go out and the hunt begins—then it's pure terror.

title: Backrooms
description: Exploration-based horror inspired by the 'liminal space' internet myth, where players must escape endless office-like rooms.
developer: Fancy Games (based on Kane Pixels mythos)
personal_review: Captures the liminal space dread perfectly. It's an unnerving descent into the uncanny, relying heavily on isolation and sound design for its scares.

title: Bendy and the Ink Machine
description: First-person puzzle horror game where players uncover dark secrets in a haunted cartoon animation studio.
personal_review: A charmingly creepy take on cartoon horror with a great vintage aesthetic. It blends puzzles and chases into a unique, ink-soaked adventure.

title: Pumpkin Panic
description: Cozy horror farming and survival indie game where players farm, fish, and fend off strange nighttime visitors.
personal_review: Surprisingly tense for a farming sim! The pressure of managing your cozy farm while the horrors descend at night is a unique, addictive blend of genres.

title: Sally Face
description: Episodic dark adventure following a boy with a prosthetic face unraveling mysteries in a haunted apartment complex.
personal_review: The story is incredibly dark, poignant, and expertly told through the unique art style. It's a gripping narrative adventure about trauma and friendship.

title: Fran Bow
description: Point-and-click psychological horror about a young girl escaping an asylum while uncovering surreal horrors.
personal_review: A wildly imaginative journey through madness. This game is visually disturbing and narratively complex—a true trip down the rabbit hole.

title: Little Misfortune
description: Darkly whimsical adventure following a curious girl exploring a dangerous world filled with misfortune.
personal_review: While lighter on traditional scares than Fran Bow, its dark fairy-tale tone and unforgettable narrator make it a tragically sweet and heartbreaking experience.

title: Devotion
description: First-person psychological horror game set in 1980s Taiwan, exploring family, culture, and mental torment.
personal_review: A masterclass in environmental storytelling, especially for its deep dive into Taiwanese culture and the horrors of religious extremism. It's a powerful narrative piece.

title: Simulacra
description: Found-phone horror where players explore a missing woman’s smartphone to uncover clues and sinister secrets.
personal_review: This 'found phone' genre is so immersive! Poking through someone else's digital life to solve a mystery feels incredibly voyeuristic and effectively creepy.

title: White Day: A Labyrinth Named School
description: Korean survival horror set in a haunted high school where players must avoid ghosts and solve puzzles.
personal_review: A classic Korean horror gem. The relentless, intense stealth gameplay against the janitor is famously terrifying and highly recommended for veteran fans.

title: No, I'm Not Human
description: Pixel-style psychological horror RPG where players confront existential dread and distorted identities.
personal_review: A very distinct, unsettling pixel RPG that delivers on existential dread. It's a thoughtful, if occasionally abstract, piece of psychological horror.

title: Dead Space
description: Sci-fi survival horror where engineer Isaac Clarke must survive aboard a derelict spaceship infested with necromorphs.
personal_review: Sci-fi horror perfected. Dismembering Necromorphs with the Plasma Cutter is a uniquely satisfying and visceral form of survival action-horror.
